jx.jx_en_mean: (of an object, especially part of a mechanism) fall smoothly into its allotted position
jx.jx_cn_mean: （物体，尤指机械装置部件）正好嵌入，恰好吻合

entry.def: If something clicks or if you click it, it makes a short, sharp sound.

example.ex: The applause rose to a crescendo and cameras clicked...
example.tran: 掌声越来越响，照相机的咔嗒声不绝于耳。
他咔嗒一声关掉了收音机。

entry.def: If you click on an area of a computer screen, you point the cursor at that area and press one of the buttons on the mouse in order to make something happen.

example.ex: I clicked on a link and recent reviews of the production came up.
example.tran: 我点击了一个链接，有关该剧的最新评论弹了出来。

entry.def: When you suddenly understand something, you can say that it clicks .

example.ex: When I saw the television report,  it all clicked...
example.tran: 我看到电视报道时才恍然大悟。

example.ex: It suddenly clicked that this was fantastic fun.
example.tran: 我突然意识到，这真是太有趣了。

entry.def: If you click with someone, you like each other and become friendly as soon as you meet. You can also say that two people click.

example.ex: They clicked immediately. They loved the same things.
example.tran: 他们随即一见如故，两人的很多爱好都相同。

example.ex: ...the man who clicks with the world's most beautiful women.
example.tran: 与世界上最美丽的女人们一见钟情的男人

1. move or strike with a noise;
2. make a clicking or ticking sound;
4. cause to make a snapping sound;
6. make a clucking sounds, characteristic of hens
7. become clear or enter one's consciousness or emotions;

Sentence.sentence: Technology has cut out much of life's donkey work, and we have more freedoms than ever: we can wear what we like and communicate with hundreds of friends at once at the click of a mouse.

jushi.english: The soldier clicked his heels and saluted.
jushi.chinese: 那个兵两脚跟咔嗒一声,立正敬礼。
